segments.text: I notice the boy is about to fall, and it’s making me really anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is tilting, and he’s still reaching for those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting, like it’s no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is completely clueless about the water and the kids.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out, and she’s not even looking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever notice before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is so tense, and I can’t look away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside is so peaceful, which makes this even more absurd.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm the woman is while everything is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is just a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
